item.title: Kent Rasmussen Petite Sirah (3)
item.description:
The wine that puts hair on your chest, assuming your glands are capable of producing chest hair.

"I would like three bottles of the Esoterica Petite Sirah, please."

The massive yet perfectly balanced red from Napa superhero Kent Rasmussen? Sure, no problem. Can I just see your ID?

"Uh, my ID?"

Yeah. If you want to buy this wine with perfect fruit and perfect structure, you're going to have to show me some ID.

"Oh. Ok. Here ya go".

Mbadinuju Onyekachukwu?

"Hmm? What?"

Your name is Mbadinuju Onyekachukwu?

"Yep. That's me."

I'm sorry, kid. But you're maybe a buck five soaking wet and your face is smoother than a baby's behind. You expect me to believe you're a 42-year-old man named Mbadinuju Onyekachukwu.

"Sure. Why not?"

In Waverly, Ohio?

"Well that's a bit racist, don't you think?"

Okay, fine. What year were you born?

"1970."

What's your address?

"101 West Main Street."

Great. Now spell your last name.

"Uh. What?"

What's wrong? Don't know how to spell your own last name?

"Psssh. Of course I do. Uh ... OK. It's O-N ... O-M-A ... T-O-P-I-A."

You just spelled onomatopoeia. Incorrectly.

"OK, OK, fine. It's a fake ID, but only because I lost my wallet."

Where?

"At a bingo game."

Nice try, buddy. Come back when you have a little 5 o'clock shadow.

Winery Retail Price: $120.00
Average Shipping:  $18.00
Woot Shipping:  (-$5.00)
Total MSRP:   $133.00
 
  • Harvest Date: September 25th
  • Grape Source: Leeds-Chavez Vineyard, Rutherford, Napa Valley
  • Grapes are Certified Organic
  • Brix at Harvest: -24.8 degrees
  • Maceration: 18 days on skins in the fermentor
  • Aging: 14 months--50% new, 50% once-used French oak barrels
  • Production: 380 cases (12x750ml)

Chemistry at Bottling

  • pH: 3.70
  • Total Acidity: 6.1 grams/liter
  • Alcohol: 14.5%
  • Free Sulfur Dioxide: 26 parts per million
  • Total Sulfur Dioxide: 65 parts per million
item.woot:subtitle: No Sirah-Bob

item.title: Toshiba 17.3" Full-HD Core i7 Laptop
item.description:
First, yes, that is a tattoo of a Toshiba Quad-Core Laptop, and second, I refuse to let you shame me for it.

In fact, it's just one of many tributes to its 8GB memory, 750GB hard drive, and USB 3.0 connectivity inked onto my body. And oh, the stories each one could tell:

On my left forearm: a picture of my Toshiba surrounded by roses and a banner that says "Mom".

On my right forearm: a picture of my Mom surrounded by roses and a banner that says "Toshiba".

Across the front of my neck: QUAD-CORE in Old English script. Lot of bleeding when I got this one. A lot of bleeding.

On my chest: two majestic bluebirds lifting my Toshiba into Heaven, surrounded by the gleaming rays of a sun whose radiant, smiling visage looks just like Beau Bridges (the truly talented one in that family). I admit, I got this one when I was drunk.

On my back: exactly like the one on my chest except the Toshiba is wearing a sombrero. I got this one when I was drunk in Tijuana.

On my right bicep: four open Toshiba laptops laid on their sides and arranged to form an ancient Sanskrit symbol of life and good fortune called a "swastika".

Right above my left ankle: a little bitty Toshiba with a purple-and-blue butterfly on its screen. You never forget your first Toshiba tat. I got this one when I pledged my sorority.

Specifications:

item.woot:subtitle: Bags Of Crapmas: Day 10

item.title: To Bee or not to Bee
item.description:
Few people know that Shakespeare originally wrote his plays to feature "bee" characters instead of humans. However, the tastes of the time required the Bard to adapt his masterpieces. Some of his early works included: 

  • King Bee-r 
  • Julius Bee-sar
  • McBeeth 
  • A Midsummer's Night Bee-m

Indeed, many of his storyline were drawn from his early experience as a beekeeper, and several famous quotes were originally apiological in nature:

  • "To bee or not to bee. That is the question." 
  • "A rose by any other name would yield as much life-giving nectar." 
  • "If I be waspish, best beware my sting."

Oh wait, that last one remained unchanged in his first-folio edits.
item.woot:shipping: Free OR $5 One-Day OR $5 Standard International
item.woot:subtitle: Pun In The Oven
item.woot:teaser: O death, where is thy sting?

woot:products.woot:product: To Bee or not to Bee

item.title: Evenflo Big Kid High Back Booster Seat
item.description:
You want your child cushioned, safe, and happy between the dual activity lights. You want your child looking around securely or maybe even napping in their Evenflo Big Kid DLX Booster Seat. But what if you put some other things in this Evenflo Big Kid DLX instead of your kid? We think it would go a little something... like this:

If you fill the Evenflo Big Kid DLX with beer, it would be a BREWster seat!

If you put a male chicken in the Evenflo Big Kid DLX, it becomes a ROOSTER seat!

If your baby gets sick, your Evenflo Big Kid DLX could just be a FLUster seat!

If the cops find someone based on information under your Evenflo Big Kid DLX, it's then a CLUEster seat!

Leave your Evenflo Big Kid DLX out on an early spring morning, you'll be wiping off a DEWster seat!

The first day your kid learns cow noises, that Evenflo Big Kid DLX will be a MOOster seat!

The first day you own your Evenflo Big Kid DLX, it'll be a NEWster seat!

Uh oh! Your little one had an accident! Looks like that Evenflo Big Kid DLX will be a POOster seat! At least until you clean it.

And, of course, your Evenflo Big Kid DLX on Halloween? When the ghosts are out? It'll be a BOOster seat! Oh, hang on. That one didn't actually change anything, did it.

Booster
Product Dimensions: 28.25" H x 16.5" W x 15.5" D
Product Weight: 9.7 lbs
Materials: Polyester / Plastic
Seat Pad Care: Machine Washable
Recommended Weight Range: 30 lbs to 100 lbs
Recommended Height Range: 40" to 57"
Date of Manufacture: September 2012
Country of Origin: China
Batteries (for lights) 6 "AAA's" (not included)

In the Box:

Choose your color

(1) Evenflo Big Kid High Back Booster Car Seat
item.woot:subtitle: Boost Her (Or Him)
item.woot:teaser: This Evenflo Big Kid DLX is designed for children. That's why it's called a booster. But imagine if it was made... for OTHER THINGS!!

woot:products.woot:product: Evenflo Big Kid High Back Booster Seat

item.title: Emeril 10-Piece Cookware Set
item.description:
Look at me! Look at me! Who am I?

"Uhhh, I dunno. A guy cooking dinner?"

Well, yeah, duh, but which guy cooking dinner?

"Mike."

C'mon! Use your imagination. Watch. I stir the sauce, throw in some spice, and BAME!

"Yeah, I have no idea."

Okay. Watch carefully. I stir a little, throw in a vegetable, and BAME!

"Why do you keep saying 'BAME'."

That's the point! Think about it. I'm stirring, stirring, I throw in a spice, and BAME!

"Yeah, sorry, I give up."

I'm Emeril! Get it! BAME!

"He says 'Bam!'."

Huh?

"It's a short 'a'. Bam."

Are you sure?

"Yeah, I'm sure."

In the Box:

(1) Emeril E432SC64 Essential Nonstick 10-Piece Cookware Set includes:

  • (1) 8" Fry Pan
  • (1) 10" Fry Pan
  • (1) 1.5 Quart Sauce Pan with Lid
  • (1) 3 Quart Sauce Pan with Lid
  • (1) 3 Quart Saute Pan with Lid
  • (1) 6 Quart Stock Pot with Lid
item.woot:subtitle: Pots and Bams!
item.woot:teaser: We can only think of one word to describe these pots and pans. It's a word Emeril himself uses a lot. Yeah, you know the word... Cookware!

item.title: Sea Eagle SE 370 Deluxe Package
item.description:
- You want to go on a hike, but you also want to bring a kayak with you in case you find a lake. Take an inflatable kayak! All you need is a giant pocket, and you can slip this kayak into it. Then, when you get to the lake, slip it out, blow it up, and go kayaking.

- If you want to go super fast on your kayak, you can give yourself a turbo boost by taking a knife, poking a hole in the back, and you get a brief boost of speed. You'll also lose the ability to use your kayak again, but that's why you buy two!

- You want to give something that weighs very little the ability to fly. All you need to do is fill this kayak up with helium and then let it go for a ride. Of course, there'll be no way to steer it, but that's a small detail.

These are only a few of many reasons you'd want an inflatable kayak. You can also just use it for regular kayaking if you want, but really, why would you want to do that?

Exterior Dimensions 12' 6" x 2' 10"
Weight 32 lbs.
Capacity 3 Persons / 650 lbs.
Interior Dimensions 10' 8" x 1' 1"
Tube Diameter 10"
Deflated Dimensions 31" x 19" x 8"
Chambers Three (Port, Starboard and Floor)
Material 38 mil PolyKrylar (K80 PVC)
Seam High Frequency Welded
Floor Inflatable I-beam Construction
Air Valves 5 Deluxe One Way

item.title: Power Advantage Trunk Organizer, 2-Pack
item.description:
With a proper trunk organizer, you won't have that junk all shakin' like jelly as you drive slow. Your junk will be properly secured, up to forty pounds. You'll also have three sections in which to put your junk, so you can keep the front junk and the back junk divided. Plus there's a mesh pocket, in case you want you get your friend's junk all up in your trunk (for purposes of transport, of course).

And don't forget the cooler! It's detachable and leak-proof, in case you don't want your junk getting all wet. Plus it's insulated as well, so if you want to throw in some cans, it's super easy! Now those cans won't touch anyone's junk by accident!

Essentially, if you've got a trunk full of junk and you like to show it off attractively, you need this organizer. Good luck!

Specifications
Compartment Dimensions: 9.4" x 7.5" x 12.6"
Organizer Dimensions: 23" x 12" x 14"
Capacity: 40 pounds
Material: 600D polycanvas

In the Box:

  • (2) Power Advantage AU-03300EZ Trunk Organizer
  • (2) Detachable Leak-Proof Thermal Shield Insulated Cooler
item.woot:teaser: Everyone appreciates a little junk in the trunk. But that junk better be orderly if you want people to respect you.

item.title: Ralph Lauren Polo T-Shirts - 7 Colors
item.description:
Conventional wisdom dictates that it's OK for humans to wear clothing with animals on it, but not the other way around. And I have to say, I'm sick of the injustice. If my horse wants to walk around downtown wearing a Ralph Lauren Polo t-shirt with a human embroidered on the chest, then suddenly he's some sort of WEIRDO.

The whole town will literally come to a standstill. Everyone will point and talk about him in a hushed tone. And they're not saying things like, "That looks like a really comfortable and stylish t-shirt." DID WE ALL SUDDENLY FORGET OUR MANNERS? I'm sorry. I don't mean to yell. It just makes me so angry. I can't wait for the day that a horse can just walk down the road wearing a t-shirt without causing a stir. Only then will we truly be free.

Size Chart

In the Box:

item.woot:subtitle: The New Normal
item.woot:teaser: You're not the boss of me or my horse.
